Name: Hathor in a papyrus thicket
Description: Sculpted in medium relief, this votive plaque in enameled stone shows the goddess Hathor in her form of a wild cow in a papyrus thicket. She is provided with a solar disk between horns and a uraeus. All of this iconography is in agreement with the representations of Hathor as tutelary divinity of the Theban region, especially at Deir el-Bahari.
